movie_title: The Ebola Virus Explained — How Your Body Fights For Survival
introduction: What does the Ebola virus actually do in your body? Why is it so dangerous and why does it kill so m

vocabulary.definition: to defeat completely; to be too much for someone to deal with
vocabulary.example: The virus can overwhelm the body's defense system very quickly.

vocabulary.definition: to increase rapidly in numbers; multiply
vocabulary.example: The virus can only survive and proliferate by infecting cells.

vocabulary.definition: relating to or resembling a dendrite, a branched extension of a nerve cell
vocabulary.example: Ebola first takes over dendritic cells, which are critical to the immune system.

vocabulary.definition: to control or influence cleverly or unscrupulously
vocabulary.example: The virus manipulates the immune system cells into sending wrong signals.

vocabulary.definition: a type of white blood cell that helps the body fight off infections
vocabulary.example: The neutrophils are activated by the virus but are not very effective against it.

vocabulary.definition: any of a number of substances, such as interferon, interleukin, and growth factors, which are secreted by certain cells of the immune system and have an effect on other cells
vocabulary.example: The immune system launches a cytokine storm as a last effort to fight the virus.
